page.title: 14LOCAL EDUCATION
page.content: The school was built in 1859 on land given by the lord of the manor. It and the adjacent school house stand alone in the parish of Weasenham All Saints approx. half mile from the village centre.It was built for 150 children. In 1985 34 children from the 2 Weasenham villages, Wellingham, Rougham and the Castle Acre district attend the school. There are two classrooms and 2 teachers and a canteen. The school house is used as an office and store.Children from Rougham arrive at 8.30a.m on the school bus which then takes children of over 11 from Weasenham to Litcham High School. Before school starts at 9.00a.m children sit and talk or play draughts or snakes and ladders. During the day children learn to read, write and use language, do mathematics,topic work,art and craft,swimming and games.
